response: narrative=Jane Black, an 85-year-old retired designer, was reported missing from her home on Munro Road, Stirling. Known for her erratic behavior, Jane often strayed from her regular walking route, leading to concerns about her safety. Her friend, Joseph Walsh, reported that she had recently been visiting a bingo hall on Nicolton Avenue, FK2 0TP, where she seemed out of sorts and mentioned working despite having an illegal employment status. Adding to the concern was her altered pattern, as she failed to check in with her grandmother, Kelly Khan. After a two-day search, Jane was eventually traced by staff to an address on Slamannan Road, Falkirk, seemingly unaware of how she had gotten there.

narrative=Jane Black was last seen near the rooftop of a building on Bruce Street, Alloa, FK10 1RX, after a neighbor reported her erratic behavior. Known for squatting in vacated properties due to her illegal employment status, Jane was apparently seeking temporary shelter. Her sister, who was in touch with Damien Stephens, expressed concerns after Jane failed to attend an appointment at the dialysis center earlier that day. Despite the low initial risk level, the unusual circumstances raised alarms. After a thorough search, she was eventually found unharmed by police on West Bridge Street, Falkirk, FK1 5AP, bringing her ordeal to a safe conclusion.
